definition: at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China

sentences.english: This writing technique transcends the concept of the fatalism of historiography that "all history is a contemporary one".
sentences.chinese: 由此突破了“一切历史都是当代史”的史学宿命。

sentences.english: The historical philosopher said: "all the history is contemporary history. ""
sentences.chinese: 历史学家克罗齐说“一切历史都是当代史”’。

sentences.english: In a sense, the statement of the contemporary historiography is a kind of pure political discourse.
sentences.chinese: 在某种意义上，当代史言说是一种纯粹的政治性话语。

sentences.english: I think that the most proper name for it is Contemporary Chinese History.
sentences.chinese: 笔者认为，称为中国当代史比较恰当。

definition: modern history (for China, from the Opium Wars until the fall of the Qing Dynasty, i.e. mid-19th to early 20th century)
narrative history/comprehensive history/a history covering an extended period

pinyin: li4 shi3 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4
